summary: This is a transcript of a DOJ Office of the Inspector General interview with Federal Bureau of Prisons Lieutenant , conducted on June 15, 2021, regarding the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York on August 9-10, 2019. The interview focuses on the lieutenant's role as SHU Lieutenant, policies and procedures in the Special Housing Unit, the requirement for Epstein to have a cellmate after returning from suicide watch, staff knowledge of that requirement, and events leading up to Epstein's death.

events.title: Epstein Incident with Cellmate Tartaglione
events.description: An incident occurred between Jeffrey Epstein and his then-cellmate Nicholas Tartaglione. Epstein was found with markings on his neck, interpreted as a suicide attempt. He was placed on suicide watch afterward.

events.title: Epstein Returns to SHU with Cellmate Requirement
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein returned to the Special Housing Unit from suicide watch. Psychology and executive management (Captain, Warden) issued instructions that he must be housed with a cellmate. An email was sent, and verbal instructions were given to staff.

events.title: Epstein's Cellmate Reyes Removed
events.description: Inmate Efrain Reyes, Epstein's cellmate, was taken to court and did not return to MCC New York (WAB - With All Belongings). This left Epstein without a cellmate, contrary to the standing requirement.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found deceased in his cell in the Special Housing Unit at MCC New York in the early morning hours. Correctional Officers Thomas and Noel discovered him.

events.title: DOJ OIG Interview of Lieutenant
events.description: The Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General conducts a voluntary, sworn interview with BOP Lieutenant regarding the death of Jeffrey Epstein and the circumstances leading up to it.

keyFacts: The witness, Lieutenant , was the SHU Lieutenant at MCC New York and asserts that it was well-known policy and practice that inmates returning from suicide watch, like Epstein, must have a cellmate. This was communicated via email, verbal instructions, and posted signs in the SHU.

Epstein's cellmate, Efrain Reyes, was removed from the institution (WAB) on August 9, 2019. The interview explores the breakdown in procedure where staff failed to ensure Epstein was given a new cellmate or placed in a hard cell alone for observation after Reyes's departure.

The witness strongly states his belief that Jeffrey Epstein died by suicide ("Nobody killed that man. He did it himself.") and defends Correctional Officer Thomas's decision to immediately enter Epstein's cell as an emergency life-saving measure.

The interview reveals significant operational issues at MCC New York, including chronic understaffing, outdated SHU cell infrastructure where inmates control their cell lights, and varying interpretations of policy regarding Lieutenant rounds and counts in the SHU.

A discrepancy in the inmate count slip from the early morning of August 10, 2019, is discussed. The initial slip showed 73 inmates in the SHU (ZA), but the correct count was 72. The witness states he would not have accepted the incorrect count and that it indicates a failure in proper procedure.
